intro: Descurainia tugayi, commonly known as Tugay's wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It produces small, yellow or white flowers and has a short, annual life cycle. Its botanical features make it well-adapted to harsh environmental conditions.
